q: Windows tablets- a "slew of them" - will be unveiled by Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer at the 2011 Consumer Electronics Show, according to an article today in the New York Times. Citing people familiar with Microsoft's plans, the Times reports that several manufacturers have signed up to build Windows tablets, including Dell and Samsung. has been outspoken about job growth, "not in the United States but in China." The Senator notes in his statement that GE has been steadily moving its manufacturing plants overseas. I hope he changes his mind and focuses on rebuilding the manufacturing sector here in the United States, not in China, and in the process creates millions of good-paying jobs, the senator said. Sen. Bernie Sanders issued the statement after making a visit to an industrial community in Vermont's Connecticut River Valley. GE didn't return a call or an email asking for comment.
